meanings.definition: Having a double-bladed axe or hatchet.
meanings.sent1: The dolabrate weapon was sharp and powerful.
meanings.sent2: The warrior carried a dolabrate axe into battle.
meanings.sent3: The dolabrate tool gleamed in the sunlight, ready for use.
meanings.sent4: Her wit was as sharp as a dolabrate blade.
meanings.sent5: The dolabrate design of the weapon made it stand out among the others.

meanings.definition: To shape or cut with a double-bladed axe.
meanings.sent1: He dolabrated the wood with precision and skill.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith dolabrated the metal into a fine sword.
meanings.sent3: The chef dolabrated the vegetables for the stir-fry dish.
meanings.sent4: She dolabrated the paper into intricate patterns.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor dolabrated the marble into a stunning statue.

meanings.definition: Resembling a double-bladed axe in shape.
meanings.sent1: The dolabrate shield had a unique design for protection.
meanings.sent2: The dolabrate building had sharp angles and edges.
meanings.sent3: The dolabrate tree stood out in the forest with its distinct shape.
meanings.sent4: Her dolabrate earrings sparkled in the light.
meanings.sent5: The dolabrate mountain peak loomed in the distance.
